Archives

2016

February 1, 2016 New Website

Welcome to my new site! I’ve created a brand new website using Jekyll and GitHub Pages, and I am in the process of transferring everything from the old sites, so please pardon the dust.

2012

February 13, 2012 Second Prize in ASCAP/SEAMUS Commission Competition

I had a great week at Lawrence University for SEAMUS! I was able to hear some new music, catch up with old friends, and make some new ones. The trip was especially exciting as I was awarded Second Prize in the 2012 ASCAP/SEAMUS Student Commission Competition! Congratulations to the First Prize recipient, Eli Fieldsteel, and the other finalists Erik DeLuca and Lanier Sammons. As part of the award, SEAMUS has commissioned me to write a new work of my own choosing for the 2013 conference at McNally Smith College of Music in St. Paul, Minnesota.

January 9, 2012 2012 ASCAP/SEAMUS Commission Finalist

I am thrilled that the resonance after… has been nominated as one of four finalists for the 2012 ASCAP/SEAMUS Student Composer Commission Competition! The piece will be performed at the upcoming 2012 SEAMUS Conference and Festival at Lawrence University, where the first and second prize winners will be announced.

2011

April 28, 2011 Cleveland Chamber Symphony

A chamber orchestra version of my Master’s thesis Shifts will be performed on the Cleveland Chamber Symphony’s Young and Emerging Composer’s Concert. The concert will take place at 7:30pm on May 9, 2011 in Glick Recital Hall at the Music School Settlement in Cleveland, OH.

April 9, 2011 First Prize in OFMC Contest

Quartet for alto flute, bass clarinet, harp, and piano has been awarded First Prize in the Ohio Federation of Music Clubs annual composition contest.

March 18, 2011 Eastman School of Music

I am very excited to announce that I will be moving to Rochester, NY to begin my doctorate in composition at the Eastman School of Music in the fall of 2011!

2010

September 7, 2010 AME 2009 Composition Competition

the resonance after… has been named as the winner of the American Modern Ensemble’s Fifth Annual Composition Competition. AME is a new music ensemble based in New York City and directed by composer Robert Paterson. The piece will be performed by AME on their upcoming Pieces of Eight concert on December 13th.

June 17, 2010 SCI/ASCAP Commission Competition Regional Finalist

the resonance after… has been selected as one of two finalists for Region V East in the 2010 SCI/ASCAP Commission Competition. The piece now moves on to the national level among 18 total scores competing for a $1500 commission and a $1000 commission.

May 4, 2010 Accent10 Summer Festival

Excited to be attending the Accent10 summer music festival held at the University of Cincinnati’s College-Conservatory of Music where I’ll work with composer Ricardo Zohn-Muldoon and have a performance of the resonance after….

March 2, 2010 Midwest Graduate Music Consortium New Music Concert

the resonance after… has been selected for performance at the Midwest Graduate Music Consortium 2010 Conference at the University of Chicago. The University of Chicago New Music Ensemble will perform the piece under the direction of Barbara Schubert on Saturday, April 17 as part of the new music concert at 7:30pm.

January 15, 2010 New York City Electroacoustic Music Festival

I will be traveling to New York City in late March to attend the New York City Electroacoustic Music Festival and have a performance of The Spark of Opposites. I am extremely excited that cellist Madeleine Shapiro will be performing the piece!

2009

December 21, 2009 Ball State University 2010 New Music Festival

The Spark of Opposites has been selected to be programmed on the 2010 New Music Festival at Ball State University! The festival takes place February 11-13, 2010.

September 21, 2009 First Prize: APSU Young Composers Competition

I was just notified that the resonance after… has won first prize in the Austin Peay State University Young Composer’s Competition! As part of receiving the award, I will attend a performance of the piece on February 1, 2010 alongside a concert of works by guest composer Chen Yi.
